Likewise with the top, when she tried to tie her bra around her chest, she found it to be a bigger struggle than usual. "I hope that the bra straps aren't going to dig into my skin" she thought. Then once she had put on some panties, she examined herself in the mirror. She tried a pose or two just for the fun of it "Secret agent Amy is here to save the world" she said in way that she thought sounded badass but really didn't work considering how squeaky her voice was. She of course was oblivious to this fact and went on saying "In a world full of despair and chaos, only one hedgehog stands between us and total annihilation". She stopped shortly after as she realised just how far removed she was from her fantasies. "If only I could prove to Sonic I'm great hero like him , then maybe he'd let me tag along on more adventures instead of leaving me here in this dull boring city". She walked over to her cupboard and took out one of her trademark red dresses. "But what can I do against Eggman? I could hardly handle myself against that Big Green Meanie of his let alone fend off his entire army." Her hands forced their way through the sleeves and her head squeezed out the top. "Sonic and Tails make it seem so easy. What am I doing wrong?"

"Sonic, Sonic, Sonic" she muttered as she walked into the living room with both of her boots in each hand. "Is he blind to my feelings? Does he not understand how I feel about him? Why can't he just give me a straight answer?" Immediately she thought back to the day before; to what she did in bed. She suddenly felt very ill inside as she rested her back against her couch. She looked up at the ceiling light directly above her. "Mother always told me that I should save my Virginity for the one I love. I know that I love Sonic but..." she trailed off as she realised where she was going. "...Does her love me too?" All of a sudden her life with Sonic seemingly flashed before her eyes. She remembered everything they had done together, when they first met on Little Planet, the first time she was kidnapped by Eggman, or Robotnik as he was known back then, their first conversation, when Sonic introduced her to Tails, the times she chased Sonic just to see if she could, finding the Flicky, Getting chased by that green robot, reuniting the Flicky with it's family, Cheering Sonic on against Chaos, following Sonic to Prison Island, Escaping said island before it exploded. Going into space with the others to stop Eggman, convincing Shadow to save the Earth and so much more. Throughout all of those memories, Sonic never once treated her as anything more than a friend. Then the reality of the situation finally hit her. "He doesn't love me".

In that brief moment, everything Amy had ever believed or found value in was swept out from underneath her. She had wasted her teenage years trying to find love where there was none to be found. She slumped down with her head on her hands... and she cried. She cried for 5 minutes. She cried for her parents, feeling she had failed them. She cried for her friend Cream, feeling guilty for dragging her along on a pointless road to nowhere. She cried for her wasted potential, feeling she could have done better if not for her obsession. But most of all, she cried for a love that never was and the thought that she might never love someone else as much as she loved Sonic. Once the pain finally petered out and Amy was finally able to look past her loss, she slowly got up from the couch, grabbed her coat and walked out the door. She had to get her Groceries after all and No-one else was going to do it for her. "But first" she thought "I need some coffee".
13112222.title: A new dawn

choices: Stay out of it; it's not your problem anyway
131122221.content:
Amy had always been the odd one out in Station Square ever since she first moved into the city. Everywhere she went, people's heads turned at the sight of a pink hedgehog in a dress walking down the street, making Amy feel isolated and shameful. When she first came to the city, she hoped to make a name for herself and become a successful young female hedgehog in a city mostly populated by humans. She relished the challenge of making a living for herself in an environment that was completely alien to her. She had every feeling that this would be a fun experience. But the city hadn't been as kind to her as she had initially thought. People would either flock around her like she was some sort of freak show or they would go out of their way to avoid her whenever possible.

She also had a hard time getting a job because of this. Even though she was a highly skilled artist and remarkably strong for her size, she would often get sidelined at job openings in favour of something the employers were more comfortable with; other humans. Even people who were gay or had serious mental disabilities had an easier time getting a job than she did (or so she thought) and even when she did land a job, it was never for more than a few months at a time until someone else with her skill set was brought in to take her place. Being rejected so many times by so many different people might have driven her into depression if not for the fact that Amy Rose was a stubborn woman who had a hard time giving up.

Nowadays, the city had grown used to having a pink hedgehog as a resident that people barely noticed anything about her aside from her energetic way of walking. She had even finally found a stable job as a painter for a redecorating company. The only people now who stared at her for more than 2 seconds at a time were tourists. But the scars still remained and no matter how helpful the people she knew were, Amy felt like they didn't respect her and that they were helping her out of basic human decency more than anything else. She constantly felt like she needed to prove her own worth when it wasn't really necessary. Out of the corner of her eye, she spied a flash of light to her right. Turning her head towards the source, she saw a man with a camera pointed right at her from across the road. The man lowered his camera and waved at her. Amy's eyes betrayed her annoyance at this, but she resolved to not let it bother her. Lashing out in public wouldn't help improve other people's perception of her after all. But she raised her hand to signal that she acknowledged the man's gesture of friendliness. "He doesn't seem bad" she said to herself "just unaware".

Soon Amy approached the crossroads where the local cafe was situated. She was imagining the sweet hot taste of her morning's coffee when she heard a muffled shout coming from an alley. Aware about the dangers of walking in dark places, Amy crept up to the entrance and took a peak. In the darkness, she caught a glimpse of someone pinning another person against a wall. "There's nowhere left for you to run" was the voice she heard; "you had your chance, and now you're all mine". Amy waited for the other person to reply, but strangely she heard nothing. No insults, no grunting, no screams, no response at all. "Why so quiet all of a sudden? No more quips eh?". Briefly, Amy considered her options. She was sure that the person talking was about to kill the other. She felt like intervening would be best, but she had no idea what had lead up to this scenario. The lack of a response from the victim made little sense to her mind. It could be a lure for someone like her to try and intervene and get ganged up on. If the other person really was in danger, there wasn't much time left. Amy had to make a decision and fast.
131122221.title: A chance to die?

choices: Someone prevents the attacker from killing Amy
1311222211.content:
"Something about this scenario seems familiar somehow" Amy thought. All of a sudden, dozens of memories came flooding back and Amy remembered all the times Sonic had gone out of his way to save her skin, even after she had royally screwed things over for both of them. In that instant, Amy had a revelation; she had been playing the role of a Damsel in Distress ever since she met Sonic. She had hardly done anything to defy this role too. She was an inconvenience by her very existence... She was on the verge of breaking down into tears again, but she stopped short as she asked herself possibly the second most important question of her life. Why did Sonic still keep coming back for her? Then it hit her; Sonic wasn't her hero, he was everybody's hero. He may not have loved her, but he still came back for her in spite of her being so clingy because he found value in everyone. What was she even doing, watching from the sidelines as someone else got killed? How could she call herself Sonic's lover if she couldn't even follow his example?... Something changed on that day. Amy changed. She decided, from that point on, she would no longer be just an inconvenience. She would become a hero in her own right. She would no longer fight purely for Sonic's affection. She would fight for whoever needed her, wherever and whenever. She would make a difference. On that day, Amy the damsel died and was reborn as Amy the hero.

Flashing back to reality, Amy now realised what she had to do; what no-one else could do. She had to save that person. Reaching behind her back, Amy drew her Piko Piko Hammer and prepared for combat. "Hey! You!" she called. The attacker stopped in his tracks and turned to face Amy "What?". "Stop this cruelty or face justice by my hands!". Amy splayed her legs in an attacking stance and held her hammer behind her ready for action.There was a moment of silence... and the attacker burst out laughing. "Ahahahaha-haaaaa. Seriously? You think you can take me out? What could a little runt like you possibly do against-GAAARUUUGGH!!!" The attacker's mocking of Amy was short lived as a solid wood hammer impacted against his chest, sending him flying backwards. While the attacker struggled to get back on his feet, Amy quickly glanced over at the victim. It was a human woman (probably just turned 20). it was too dark for Amy to make out any specific details. She appeared to be more surprised than hurt which was a relief. Amy thought of saying something to ease her concerns, but she didn't want to get her hopes up in the event that her first real shot at playing hero ended in failure.

The attacker by this point had got back on his feet and was readying for a counterattack "You... You got lucky" he responded. "That was luck? And here I though you wanted me to get a clear shot at you" Amy joked. The attacker lunged at Amy the moment she had finished speaking. She blocked his first attack with her hammer. Then she ducked under his second attack and rolled off to the side. The attacker tried to cut off her escape, but she leaped into the air, pushed off against the wall behind her and kicked the attacker square in the jaw. The attacker paused to feel his jaw and then he looked at his hand. Blood. This little pink hedgehog had actually caused him to bleed. He became enraged at the thought of a hedgehog besting him in physical strength. "You'll never leave this alley alive" he growled throwing punch after punch in Amy's direction. Amy couldn't dodge all of his punches so she was forced to back up. She realised that the attacker was trying to forced against the wall and restrict her defence and so readied her hammer. grasping it in both hands, she swung once more... and missed. The attacker, spying an opportunity, kicked Amy even further down the alley.

She tried to get back to her feet, but the attacker knocked her back down before that could happen. By this point Amy was feeling disoriented, which wasn't helped when the attacker picked her up by the neck and began punching her in the gut. The pain made it all the more worse and she felt dangerously close to passing out. At one point Amy thought she was coughing up blood, but she couldn't be sure. The attacker stopped punching for a moment to gloat about his victory, but Amy was so delirious she couldn't hear anything he said. She felt horrible for being beaten up so easily by this thug. She felt like utter shit however for failing to be strong for even one person's life. If she wasn't so exhausted, she would have started to cry again. Then out of the corner of her eye, she realised that she couldn't see the victim anywhere. "At least she's out of harm's way" she croaked. the attacker had finished gloating at this point and was preparing to deal the finishing blow. In those brief seconds, Amy saw her life flash before her eyes. With nothing left to give and no chance of survival, Amy could only say one thing before her certain death. "I'm sorry Sonic, I love you"...
1311222211.title: Time to woman up

13112222111.content: Who saves Amy from certain death?
13112222111.title: Choose your saviour

choices: Amy stays in her rage form
131122221111.content:
All hope seemed lost for Amy. She was beaten, badly bruised, in more pain than she had ever been before in her life and about to die at the hands of some lowly street thug. What she would give for a miracle right about now... and she got one. There was a loud *THUMP* and suddenly Amy fell out of the attacker's hands and onto the ground. She couldn't care less what had happened though as her mind was in the midst of a raging battle with the rest of her body. She desperately wanted to let sleep overtake her and for this pain to end, but she knew that if she gave in now, she would almost certainly get killed by that thug. She forced her eyes open and her ears to start listening again. She could now see clearly what had happened. The woman had returned. She had assaulted the attacker while he was distracted with Amy. Now he had her in an arm lock and was pounding on her chest. Each punch sent waves of anger throughout Amy. "How dare he act so callously towards a fellow human!"Amy thought. "What right has he to give such undeserved pain? He thinks he can get away with anything!" Something began building up inside Amy. It was like some sort of energy, only Amy had no idea where it was coming from. "He thinks that the rules don't apply to him!" This energy inside her began building with her rage. Everything became tense and unstable as Amy slowly rose to her feet. "I'll show him!" now the energy was reaching breaking point, like it could destroy Amy at any moment if she allowed it to rise any higher. "I WILL SHOW HIM!!" And yet she withstood it. The immense feeling of strength Amy felt was unlike anything she had ever felt before. Now she could see clearly just how much pain the woman was in. That did the trick.

"LEAVE HER ALONE!!!!" she practically screamed. The attacker turned to face his supposedly defeated opponent and looked on in mortified terror. The once little pink hedgehog who had barely come up to his belly button before was now just an inch smaller than him in height. Her dress unfortunately had not grown with her, leaving her with a much more skintight figure and panties that were clearly visible to all who cared to look. What's more, she was now surrounded by some kind of pink aura that flickered and fizzled like fire and her eyes almost appeared to be glowing. The sight of this hulking beast was enough to cause the attacker to freeze in place in fear. So much so that he didn't even try to dodge the massive sucker punch that Amy dealt him. He was sent flying back out into the daylight, stopping only just before the road. He quickly got back on his feet, but he didn't even try to fight back. Somehow he had a feeling that this was one person he could never beat in a million years. All the while, Amy was slowly advancing towards him, fists ready to deal another devastating sucker punch. It took all of her will power to prevent herself from killing him right then and there. Instead she left him with one simple warning; "YOU ARE A DISGUSTING DIRTBALL OF A HUMAN BEING!!! KNOW YOUR PLACE IN THIS WORLD OR YOU WILL HAVE NO PLACE IN IT!!!!". After that, the attacker scampered off as fast as he could down the street, screaming to all who would hear him about the little pink spawn from hell coming to eat his soul.
131122221111.title: The first victory

choices: Hell no, Ditch her. She's a weirdo
Say yes. That's what a good friend would do
1311222211112.content:
It was at this point Amy finally became aware of the great change that had occurred. She took a quick glance at her body, admiring the transformation and then down at her dress. She gasped; Her panties were showing. Her face flushing redder than sunburnt skin, She quickly whipped her hands in front of her crotch. The embarrassment at being under dressed in public quickly transformed her anger into shame. Mere seconds later, her aura dissipated and she shrunk back down to her normal size; or at least a size that no-one would notice, she hoped. Amy was in stunned silence for a while, as she tried to wrap her head around what had just happened. Then she remembered; the woman she saved was still around. Amy turned to face her. "Don't be alarmed." she tried to say calmly. "You can go now. no need to tha-"WHAT THE FUCK ASSHOLE?!". Amy froze; the sudden outburst of the woman was not the reaction she had been expecting. "Uh. Come again?"

"I totally had that wimp on the ropes!" the woman continued. "I was gonna beat his sorry ass up so bad! It would have been so cool! Now you've gone and scared him off! Boooo!". The woman folded her arms in a disapproving way and leaned back against the wall. There was another moment of silence. Amy's eye twitched. "Do you go around trying to get yourself in trouble?!?" she exclaimed in disbelief. "And what if i do?" the woman replied. "You can't stop me". "That guy didn't look very 'on the ropes' to me" Amy retorted. "He probably would have killed you if I hadn't showed up!". "Well I was TRYING to lull him into a false sense of security. He was such a novice. I practically had a clean shot at his balls before you showed up". "Does your mother know what you're doing out here?". "Oh sure, play the mother card why don't you. Not everyone has a good relationship with their parents missy!". "That's no excuse! You should have been more careful!". "What? And live a dull boring life in a city full of monotonous drones?". Amy was about to say something about how life wasn't just about the thrills when she realised that the woman had a point. Station Square was a incredibly boring place to live. Hardly anything major ever happened in it. The last major thing to happen in it was Chaos' culling of the city and that was nearly 3 years ago. She of course couldn't possibly admit it if she wanted to keep this woman out of trouble however. Instead Amy decided that it wasn't worth trying to argue with someone who clearly had a death wish. "Bye" She muttered, turning towards the street. She had better things to do than argue in an alley with someone who clearly didn't know better.

"Wait!" Amy turned and saw the woman stretching her hand out to her. She retracted it the moment Amy turned. "What?" Amy barked back. The woman looked away briefly before saying. "Sorry, thanks for the help". "What?" said Amy again, only more inquisitively this time. "I said sorry... thanks for your help". The moment those words reached her ears, Amy felt as if she had been lifted off the ground by angels. But she was confused; why did this woman act so apprehensive only to cave in when she tried to leave. Then it hit her. not many people would want a lifestyle like this without good reason. "She must be trying to fill a hole in her life with action and danger. Oh god how lonely is she? What must she ha-" "Do you mind? I can hear your inner monologue from over here" The woman's interruption shook Amy back to reality. "Wait, you heard my thoughts?" Amy said "How?". "It's called 'Rule of Funny' friend" replied the woman snarkily. "Try looking it up sometime". "Rule of what?". "Ugh, look. You ever watched that scene in Who framed Rodger Rabbit where Rodger and Valiant are cuffed together and they have to free themselves and after about 30 minutes, as Valiant is cutting through the cuffs with a saw, Rodger just slips his hand out of the cuff and he explains that he could only do so when it would be funny to do so?". "Uuuuh, yeaaaah?". "That's basically Rule of Funny in a nutshell" finished the woman.

Amy huffed in a confused strop. "Well, if you're quite done scrambling my brain, would you care to tell me if I'm right?". "Sorry no can do" replied the woman in a very blunt manner. "Why?". "Because nerds hate spoilers". "But... there's no-one else around" muttered Amy, confused as all hell. "Look, could I at least know your name please?". "Sure, my name is Wendy" said the woman in a chipper tone. Wendy suddenly looked shocked and then very guilty. "Listen, I uhh... I'm not really supposed to be talking about this stuff to other people..." she trailed off. Then she placed her hand gently on Amy's shoulder "Could you do me a solid and forget about everything I just said please?". Amy looked into her eyes. They were filled with a genuine fear and their amber hue made them seem even softer up close. Amy had a sneaking suspicion that Wendy needed this more than she had ever needed anything before in her life. Could she really be trusted to not tell anyone else? She had only known Wendy for a minute or so and yet she already felt a special connection with her.. She could potentially be a powerful ally if she were to be swayed.
1311222211112.title: New contacts

choices: Pry Wendy for information on what just happened
Don't bother Wendy about what just happened
13112222111122.content:
"I promise to not tell another living soul that you can read other people's minds" Amy said finally. Wendy's eyes were filled with such glee the moment those words left Amy's lips. "Oh thank you thank you thank you thank you" she blurted, giddily jumping up and down on the spot. "Uhh... yeah-heah" Amy replied with much worry emanating from her voice. "So are you reading my mind right now as we speak?". She dreaded the thought of Wendy learning about her crush on Sonic. "Oh, I wouldn't worry about that" Wendy assured her. "Keep in mind that I can only read minds when the rule of funny dictates I can, so your thoughts right now are without a doubt yours alone". Amy sighed with relief, which she realised was a pretty bad move in hindsight since it gave Wendy the idea that she had something worth hiding. If it did however, Wendy chose not to pursue it and instead asked Amy if she could join her in the Cafe. "Of course" Amy said. "I wouldn't be much of a friend if refused would I?". Wendy didn't answer but Amy had a strange feeling that she understood where she was coming from.

"Sorry again for shouting at you back there" Wendy said. "I thought you were just a random asshole trying to undercut my moment of badassery... I take great pride in my fighting prowess.". "I can imagine" Amy remarked. "Oh great" she thought to herself. "First Sonic, then Knuckles, then Shadow and now Wendy. How many people's inflated egos must I carry the burden of". She veered clear from that train of thought as quickly as possible in case this supposed 'Rule of Funny' allowed Wendy to get another peek into her head. "So..." Wendy began. "That super size thing you did back there... What exactly was that?". "I... honestly don't know" Amy said in a distant manner. "That has never happened to me before. I've no clue where it came from". "Do you know what triggered it?" Wendy said. "Well... no it's too stupid". "What is?". "It doesn't make a lick of sense, but I was feeling overwhelmingly angry at exactly the same time as I grew". "You think that your supersize power is triggered by anger?" Wendy queried. "It shouldn't have by all manner of science and logic" Amy pondered "but it's the only explanation I can think of". As the two females entered the cafe, they began to posit as many explanations for Amy's power as they could. "A biological response?". "If it was then surely someone would have heard of it by now". "Genetic mutation?". "Genes don't mutate in a matter of seconds". "Increased calcium intake?". Did you see any needles filled with calcium in that alley?". "Possession by demon?". "Okay, that one's grabbing at straws Wendy". "Says the girl who thinks anger is some kind of steroid".

"Good morning Amy and-urm-ma'am" Amy and Wendy ended their conversation and turned to face the man at the counter. "Hey Mitch" said Amy. "Just a coffee for me please". Mitch nodded and turned to face Wendy "And what about you err...". "Wendy; and do you have any tea?" came a sharp reply. "Sure do, I'll leave you two alone seeing as you're getting so comfortable with each other". "Is that a double entendre?". "It's whatever you want it to be " said Mitch with a wink. Wendy frowned before asking "Do you take credit?". Just then Mitch raised a finger, saying "Oh and before I forget, Is your last name Perindreen?". Wendy froze. Clearly she hadn't counted on anyone recognising her. Amy found it odd, not just because it seemed odd that Wendy would try to hide her last name, but because Mitch had everyone in Station Square's names down to a tee and seeing him fail to recall Wendy's name was ringing some alarm bells in her mind. "Errr y-y-yes". Wendy faltered. "Because someone here has already paid for your tea". Wendy leaned over the counter, glaring into Mitch's eyes as she did so. "Where is he?". Mitch meekly pointed towards the left side of the cafe. Wendy and Amy both turned their heads at the exact same time, and saw a bald man in a gray shirt, wearing sunglasses who promptly signalled a salute in their direction. Wendy clenched her fists in anger. "Friend of yours?" suggested Amy. "Hardly" muttered Wendy. "Stay here. This is personal" and she promptly stormed over to where the man was seated. Amy deliberated over whether or not she should intervene, but after the chewing out she had received from Wendy in their first meeting, she felt inclined to watch from afar and see how the human female fared by herself.

She couldn't hear the words being exchanged between the two people, but she didn't need any words to be able to tell what was going on. This man was a longtime obstacle in Wendy's life and he was trying to sweet talk her. Wendy obviously took great offence to this, but her anger was further compounded when the man produced some photographs; most likely to try and blackmail her. Wendy did not even give a response to that. Why should she? It was exactly what the man wanted and Wendy was not going to give in to his pressuring. But wait! The man was now presenting a briefcase to her. He opened it up and inside were thousands of crisp, freshly pressed dollars. Just what kind of business had Wendy been dealing with before the two of them first met? This was the straw that broke the camel's back as they say. Wendy suddenly and without warning, grabbed the man by the collar and tossed him out the window onto the street. Everyone in the cafe immediately turned to face her in shocked silence. There was a few seconds of waiting as Wendy stood still by the wall, waiting for someone to make a move. The tension was high at this point. Amy couldn't quite believe what she was seeing. Other people in the cafe began to fear that they might shortly become victims of a mass killing. Only Mitch remained unfazed as he brought Amy's coffee and Wendy's tea to the counter. Then Wendy turned around at last, a pistol suspended between her index finger and thumb raised for all to see. "He had a concealed weapon" Wendy muttered as if believed she could reason with the customers that she wasn't a psycho. She then walked over to the counter and placed the pistol down on the table. "Give that to the police." She said to Mitch. "They should be able to find enough of his fingerprints on that to put him away for a long time". With that, Wendy snatched up her tea and proceeded to drink. Everyone else in the cafe continued on with what they were doing like nothing had ever happened, most likely out of fear that something similar might happen to them. Amy stared at Wendy for a good half a minute before taking a sip of her coffee. "What the fuck was that?" she muttered under her breath.
13112222111122.title: Bonding

choices: Amy lets go and FINALLY grows into a giantess
Amy manages to defuse her growth
131122221111221.content:
"Did you say something Amy?" asked Wendy. "What the fuck was that" Amy said again, only louder this time. Wendy grimaced for a second. "What was what?" she said. "Don't act like you don't know" Amy huffed. "You're hiding something aren't you". Wendy looked as if she was trying to make up an excuse, but Amy gave her such a disapproving glare that she couldn't find the strength within herself to say it and gave up. "Okay" she said at last. "I'll come clean. That guy I just punched out was once my boss". Amy tilted her head in disbelief. "You're just full of surprises aren't you?" She muttered. "There's more" Wendy added. "I've made some pretty bad mistakes in my time. One of those mistakes just so happens to be a one time deal he made with me to take out some guy that was getting in his way. Normally I wouldn't have considered it, but I needed the money desperately. Now he won't leave me alone with his constant attempts to get me back to doing work for him. I had hoped I could convince him to leave in peace, but when he pulled out that case of money... I just couldn't help myself. The thought of killing just for money makes me so mad". Amy's ears perked up at that. The way Wendy worded that last statement implied that she was just opposed to killing for money and not killing in general. With this observation in mind, Amy asked "Why?".

"Hired Assassins are the scum of the earth" muttered Wendy. "They don't care about who they kill, how they kill them or how unfulfilling their job is. They only care about the money. You should never do anything just for money. You should have a passion for your work. When you're the best at what you do, you have to have some standards. No-one should feel the need to cower in fear that their life could end at any moment. They should see their end coming and at the hands of someone with honour God damn it!" Amy just sat there, mesmerised that someone with a history of murder could be so be so sympathetic towards potential victims. Wendy slumped down with her head in her arms. "Sorry for telling you" she whispered. "You must hate me for that". Amy hesitated to speak. She was adamantly opposed to taking someone else's life and under any other circumstances she would have immediately detained Wendy and dragged her off to be arrested. But the way Wendy spoke as well as the things she spoke about... Amy could tell that Wendy felt a large degree of regret for her past actions. "How many people exactly have you killed?" she asked. ".... 6" came a disheartened reply. " Please believe me when I say I'm not a monster".

Amy felt horrible as she spoke again. "I really shouldn't be saying this... but... well...... just don't kill any more people please". Wendy almost looked like she could cry. "Thank you..." Amy didn't feel like saying any more. She just went back to drinking her coffee. "By the way" Wendy added. "I noticed that you have a tissue wrapped around your finger. It's awfully bloody. Did you cut yourself?". "Yeah" Amy said "Did it while chopping cucumbers. I'm going to swap it out for a plaster when I get back home". Just then, Amy suddenly felt a warm fuzzy feeling spreading across her body. It was the kind of fuzziness she usually felt when she imagined herself in the loving embrace of her crush Sonic. She had no idea what it was, but it felt good. "Mmmhh" she sighed blissfully as she felt herself being surrounded by feelings of softness. Every part of her being felt weightless. A smile crept onto her face and she shivered with pleasure. "So cozy... So sleep- Hang on! This seems awfully familiar." It was at that moment Amy felt a tightness around her feet. She looked down... and saw that her shoes were bulging: being pushed by her feet. "Wait. Am I getting bigger?" she wondered. Her question was soon answered for her as she noticed that the shelves behind the counter were descending ever so slightly. Or rather she was ascending past them. "Oh crap" she thought and she quickly jumped down running for the door. "Hey!" shouted Wendy "Where ya going?". "I've just remembered. I got some groceries I need to take care of!" Amy called back. "See you same time next week okay?". The moment Wendy waved her a 'goodbye'. Amy darted out the door, across the road and back down the street as fast possible.

"Please no. Not now. Not out here!" Amy tried to fight back against the growing feeling inside of her, but it wasn't showing signs of stopping. Her body expanded and stretched more and more with each passing second. She could feel her bra getting tighter and her breasts were feeling so squashed between it and her seemingly unending expansion. Her dress began hugging her figure like a wine around a tree. Her panties became tighter and more restrictive. Her feet became so swollen that she could no longer run properly with her tight boots. "No no no no no!" Amy cried. 155311.content:
Amy had agreed later that day to test Tails new machine while he was gone. It was only for a day, so she agreed. She was also very excited about it. Tails said the machine would change her body structure and she hoped to use it to get Sonic to fall for her. Amy now entered the lab and approached Tail's machine. "Now let's see here..." Amy said flipping through body options. She then found one with the look of Rouge's body, long and thin. "This will be perfect!" Amy exclaimed. Upon turning around, she tripped over a wire that snapped out of place and she tripped over it and fell in the machine, with the door closing behind her. "Wait...What? No!" she screamed banging on the machine door, but it was too late and she gave up. She suddenly felt her feet feel incredibly weak. "Oh what now?" she said looking down, noticing her shoes melting with her feet as they began to form a pinkish-red puddle. "NO! I'M MELTING!" She pulled out her pink phone and attempted to call Sonic, but the phone slipped between her melting hand and hit the ground. Then half her dress and entire lower half melted into a light red-pink puddle. She felt her facial features melt away as the rest of her dress and head melted. The once Sonic-obsessed hedgehog had just become a red-pink puddle with a red head band floating on top, the tan color that was around her mouth area now made up a very small portion of the puddle. Amy could still see, hear and talk, but those facial features were now drifting around inside the amassed puddle.

Then...

1553112.content:
from outside the tank Amy heard a mechanical voice saying "deconstruction complete, preparing to begin reconstruction." and calmed.

This was apparently supposed to happen. that was good. she thought. Allowing her panic to subside believing the main problem past, she began exploring her new form. other than, for lack of a better term, being able to 'feel' light and sound pass through her liquid mass, allowing her to see and hear, but she had no real control of anything. her form was too watery to control.

How long was the machine going to take? She thought, feeling the return of her worry that the wire had been something... "Error. Unable to apply template for reintegration, Equipment failure: no immager connected." ...important. With the return of the mechanical voice and it's message the panic returned. If by template it meant rouge's body shape, did this mean it couldn't give her back a shape? ANY shape? was she stuck like this?

"Atempting to reintegrate without template, stand by." what the heck did that mean? reintegrate into WHAT?

as the machine worked Amy was to busy panicking to realize she was actually moving her watery form, her control of it growing by the second. It had gotten thicker, now more the consistency of molasses, and with enough surface tension to hold itself in a single mass. her color was much more uniform as well having gotten stirred around enough to be an even pink color all the way through.

"Partial reintegration complete" the mechanical voice said, as the chamber began to unlock.
No! don't open! I'll spill everywhere and this will never get fixed! the former hedgehog's addled mind thought, watching in horror as the hatch opened, and...

nothing happened.

That was when she noticed, she was still a melted pool of liquid, but it was flowing away from the door in defiance of gravity. Relaxing, the pool stopped and slowly spread out of the chamber, rekindling her panic and causing it to flow inward again. The cycle would repeat three or four times before Amy realized it was happening because she didn't want to flow out of the capsule. it was like tensing a muscle, she could pull herself in a certain direction.

I'm.. I'm doing that? She realized beginning to experiment with making her liquid self move around.
